page.title: 08Health And Welfare Provision
page.content: Residents are cared for by a group practice at Swanley(5 male doctors and 3 female plus a nurse)most visits are to the surgery by bus or car but home visits are covered by the DHSS. Prescriptions are dispensed in Swanley where there are three chemists shops. District nurses cover the area and social workers arrange for meals on wheels and home help. Voluntary groups based in Swanley offer help to blind and handicapped people. Swanley council offer reduced priced meals at Meeting Point plus holidays at the council hotel at Eastbourne at reasonable prices.The nearest dentists are in Swanley and the nearest hospitals in Dartford and Sidcup.The baby clinic is held in the village hall and the mobile library visits once a week.There is a sub-post office but it may be closed in the future.
